results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses power
results.brief_description: Lord Russell speaks of three kinds of power: the power of armies and police forces, economic power and propaganda power. He discusses good and bad motives for wanting power and points out that the use and abuse of power is related to the difference between good government and bad. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses philosophy
results.brief_description: Lord Russell gives his definition of philosophy and speaks of the relationship and difference between science and philosophy. He describes his own philosophy and discusses the uses of philosophy, the trends of present-day philosophy and the future. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses mankind's future
results.brief_description: Lord Russell speaks about his fears and hopes for the future and explains that he sees the possibility of a world so organised and static that there will be no fun to be had anywhere. He points out also that with education and the realisation that many of the world’s troubles lie in individual psychology, we could abolish war, poverty and disease. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses happiness
results.brief_description: Lord Russell describes the factors which he considers necessary for happiness: health, sufficient means to keep one from want, happy personal relations and successful work. He also discusses what he considers to be the sources of unhappiness: worry, envy and boredom. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertolucci shoots 1900
results.creator_credit: Luca Olmastroni, Daria Cinematografica and Gianni Amelio
results.brief_description: A documentary made during the shooting of Bertolucci’s “Novocento” which includes comments by Bertolucci on his attitudes to film-making as well as reflecting the particular style of this film-maker. Highlights the role of the director, his relationship with the crew and points to various film-making techniques by showing the shooting of specific scenes. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Berth 24
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and J.B. Holmes
results.brief_description: Describes the ‘turn-round’ of a ship - S.S. Bravo - which plies with freight and passengers between Hull and Gothenburg. For an army of men, from river pilot to Stevedore, each ‘turn-round’ is a test of professional skill, and a race against time if tides are to be caught and schedules kept. The film tells the story of what this means to George Moore, a foreman docker, and to a Swedish passenger who comes to England as a buyer of British goods.

results.title: Bert Newton's IMT [Live from HMAS Cerberus]
results.creator_credit: Terry Gill, National Nine Network and Bill Beams
results.brief_description: A record of the IMT live broadcast from HMAS Cerburus during Navy Week in 1970 which includes commercials. Bert Newton is joined by Lucky Star; Gaynor Bunning; Tim Evans; Johnny Walker; Alison Durban; Judy Scott; Bettina and Bryce; Miss Teen America and Patti McGrath. Commercials include: Yalumba Brandivino; Mastercut butchers; Victa mowers (Pete Smith); National vacuum cleaners; Yates lawn seeds; Remy Martin Brandy; Benson & Hedges cigarettes (Stuart Wagstaff); Capitol bread; SPC canned fruit; Ponds face cream; Ponds busy girl instant shampoo; State Savings Bank; Kraft ‘quick n easy’ dried peas (Bruce Mansfield); Cedel anti-perspirent; Monash cigarettes; Gold Medallion homes; Lipton tea bags.

results.title: Bert Flugelman: public sculptor (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lesley Hammond, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: The work of Bert Flugelman is presented, particularly the design and casting of his famous sculpture pieces in Martin Place, Sydney, in Canberra and in Adelaide. His work in other mediums, e.g. pottery and painting is also presented, demonstrating the process of sculpture construction.

results.title: Bernstein on Beethoven: a tribute
results.creator_credit: CBS, Amberson Productions and Humphrey Burton
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein traces the life of Beethoven and plays sections from the “Piano Concerto No.1 in C Major” in a musical celebration of Beethoven’s Bicentennary at the Vienna Festival of Music. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Berlin: symphony of a great city
results.brief_description: A documentary by Walther Ruttman, dealing with a day in the life of a city and heavily influenced by Eisenstein’s ‘Potemkin’. Ruttman emphasized visual rhythms in his cutting and strove to give his films a symphonic organization and as such the film was widely influential to other filmmakers showing how the motifs of everyday life could be patterned thematically. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.
